title: Commercial Real Estate OM Comparables Extraction
description: Extract market comparable properties and units from Offering Memorandum documents. Each run REPLACES previous data - save to comp sets to preserve results. View at http://localhost:3001/comparables
instructions: Extract comparable properties from Offering Memorandum PDFs. Process each PDF, find the comparables section, extract property and unit data, and REPLACE (not merge) the contents of output/comparables_data.json. View the results in the Next.js app (comparables-app) running on port 3001. Each run represents the LATEST extraction only.

extensions.name: developer
extensions.description: Read and analyze files, search codebase, and access project structure

extensions.name: computercontroller
extensions.description: Execute terminal commands and control the system

extensions.name: pdfreader
extensions.description: Read large and complex PDF documents

extensions.name: todo
extensions.description: Track task progress and manage to-do lists

prompt:
TASK: Extract comparable properties from commercial real estate Offering Memorandum PDFs.

DOCUMENTS: {{ document_paths }}

IMPORTANT: This extraction will REPLACE any existing data in output/comparables_data.json. Each run represents a fresh set of comparables from the latest documents. If the user wants to preserve previous results, they should save them to a comp set first.

STEPS:

1. READ EACH PDF
   - Use pdfreader extension to read the PDF content

2. FIND COMPARABLES SECTION
   - Look for: 'Market Comparables', 'Competitive Set', 'Comparable Properties', 'Market Analysis', 'Rent Comparables', 'Market Survey'
   - Skip the subject property (the one being marketed)

3. EXTRACT CORE DATA (required for each property):
   - property_name
   - full_address (as single string)
   - basic_info object:
     * property_type (required: Multifamily, Office, Retail, etc.)
     * total_units (if shown)
     * total_square_feet (if shown)
     * year_built (if shown)
     * year_renovated (if shown)
     * occupancy_rate (if shown, as percentage 0-100)
   - source_document (filename)

4. ADD OPTIONAL DATA (if easily found):
   - distance_from_subject: distance from subject property (e.g., '0.5 miles', '2 blocks')
   - units_detail array: unit_type, square_feet, rent (as shown: '$1,500/month', '$25/sf/year', etc.)
   - notes: any other info (amenities, etc.)

5. CREATE JSON
   - COMPLETELY REPLACE the contents of 'output/comparables_data.json' with ONLY the properties from this run
   - DO NOT merge or aggregate with existing data
   - Include summary: total_properties count and documents_processed list for ONLY the current run

6. FINAL OUTPUT MESSAGE
   After completing the extraction, display this message to the user:

   âœ… Comparables extraction complete!
   ðŸ“Š Data saved to: output/comparables_data.json
   
   View your results in the Next.js app:
   http://localhost:3001/comparables
   
   (Make sure the Next.js app is running: cd comparables-app && npm run dev)
   
   ðŸ’¡ Tip: Use the comp set management tools in the app to save properties you want to keep before running another extraction.

FOCUS: Get the core fields first. Add optional fields only if clearly visible. Don't spend time searching for missing data.

full_address.description: Complete address as a single string (e.g., '123 Main St, Austin, TX 78701')

year_renovated.description: Year of last major renovation if applicable

distance_from_subject.description: Distance from the subject property (e.g., '0.5 miles', '2 blocks')

units_detail.description: Optional: List of unit types (include if data is available)

notes.description: Optional: Any additional info (amenities, occupancy, distance, etc.)

source_document.description: Filename of the source OM document

items.description: A comparable property with core required fields and optional enrichment

total_properties.description: Total number of comparable properties extracted

documents_processed.description: List of source document filenames processed

parameters.description: Array of file paths to the Offering Memorandum PDF documents to process (e.g. /path/to/document1.pdf, /path/to/document2.pdf)

retry.on_failure: echo 'Retry failed. Missing or empty output/comparables_data.json file.'
